name: Carman Licciardello Songs Quiz | Carman | 10 Questions

questions.text: From what song on his 1993 album "The Standard" would you hear the words "I love Jesus yes I do. I love Jesus how 'bout you"?
questions.explanation:
Sunday School Rock.

	Carman was born January 19, 1956. His full name is Carman Dominic Licciardello.  "The Standard" includes songs such as "America Again", "The River" and "Marchin' and Movin'".

questions.text: What does "R.I.O.T." stand for in the album of the same name released in 1995?
questions.explanation:
Righteous Invasion of Truth.

	Not only is Carman a singer, he is also an evangelist.  "R.I.O.T. (Righteous Invasion of Truth)" along with the title track contains songs such as "God is Exalted", "No Monsters" and "Seven Ways to Praise".

questions.text: On his 1988 album "Radically Saved" which song has these lyrics..."Now Jesus healed a blind man and made him see. He cast those demons out of the man from Galilee."?
questions.explanation:
I've Been Delivered.

	When Carman was a child he played the drums in his mother's band. At age 20, he moved to California. Other songs on "Radically Saved" include "Soap Song" and "No Way, We Are Not Ashamed".

questions.text: On Carman's "Mission 3:16" album, which came out in 1997, which song has the lyrics, "Is your name in the book, is your name in the book of life?"?
questions.explanation:
The Courtroom.

	Carman became a Christian while attending an Andrae Crouch concert. Other songs on the "Mission 3:16" album include, "Jesus is the Lamb", "Never Be" and "Do I Do".

questions.text: What song on the album "I Surrendered All" released in 1997 contains the lyric "He is my everything, master of everything."
questions.explanation:
His Name is Wonderful.

	In 1980, he created his first album called "God's Not Finished With Me Yet". Other songs on the "I Surrender All" CD include, "The Old Rugged Cross", "Tell Me the Story of Jesus" and "Jesus Paid It All".

questions.text: What song from "The Standard" released in 1993 contains the lyrics "His honor and glory we will obey"?
questions.explanation:
Great God.

	In 1983 Carman released "Sunday's on the Way" which began a string of chart topping songs.  Other songs on "The Standard" are "Sunday School Rock", and "Now's the Time".

questions.text:
From which song, the title track of the album released in 1982, are the lyrics, "Well I got this friend named T.J. Clyde
Who sees this strength of God inside
So he says to me, "Hey, I want Some-O-Dat"?
questions.explanation:
Some-O Dat.

	Carman's first number one song came from the album "The Champion" in 1985. The song was "The Champion".  The song "Some-O Dat" from the album of the same name is about a man who wants what the Christian has. However, he does not want to get saved. So the Christian explains to him that to have "some o dat" you need to be saved.

questions.text:
What song from "Addicted to Jesus" released in 1993 contains the lyrics, "I'm so glad that the Lord saved me
I'm so glad that the Lord saved me
If it had not been for Jesus,
Where would I be?
I'm so glad that the Lord saved me"?
questions.explanation:
1955.

	In 1989, Carman released his first number one album "Revival in the Land".  Other songs on the "Addicted to Jesus" album include "Jesus is the Way" and "The Third Heaven".

questions.text: What song from the 1993 album "Revival in the Land" contains the following lyrics? "Now as a Christian from a little church with God's call on my life, a man of faith and power with a challenge to grow I did what any saint would do in my situation. I tore it up said, 'Lord, no way I'm gonna go.'"
questions.explanation:
A Witch's Invitation.

	In 1992 Carman was named Contemporary Christian Artist of the Year by Billboard Magazine. "A Witch's Invitation" talks about the need to have Jesus in your life to fight off the evil in the world. Christians believe that without Jesus, Satan has power over you and you are lost in a world of sin. However, with Jesus, you can resist temptation and Satan will not have power over you.

questions.text:
On Carman's album "No Plan B" released in 2014, which song contains these lyrics: "God you always do what Your word says
It accomplishes everything it set out to do"?
questions.explanation:
Jesus Heal Me.

	On February of 2013 Carman announced that he had cancer and was given 3-4 years to live. However, in 2014 he announced the doctors had pronounced him cancer free. In 2014, he released the album "No Plan B". The title track of the song talks about how there's only one way to Heaven. Christians believe that Jesus is the way to Heaven. The lyrics in the chorus of "No Plan B" state "The road's been a long one, it's always been a fightBut God had my back deep into the nightHe's been my plan A, now everyone can seeI'm living for the Lord and there's no plan B"
